job_title: Call Center Agent in London, England

review_title: Overall one of my favourite call centre jobs
pros:
Extremely tolerant and relaxed work environment.


Accomodating to what you may need out of the job.


Sense of purpose and accomplishment.


No meaningless targets, no breathing down your neck from supervisors and overall an environment where you can fit in very easily. For a call centre this is virtually unheard of.


Certain shifts can be essentially a 'keeping the lights on' where you're just there to ensure the 24 hour line is manned. 


Very little pedantry and there is often a varied amount of training that keeps life interesting.


An overall increasing investment in making the work easier to manage with improved software.
cons:
The pay was not as high as some call centres but was more than adequate.


Work hours can take a toll on you long term given the work load sometimes but that is countered a little with some shifts being empty.


Some inter-department politics that affect the outlook of the company, but i've experienced far worse in other call centre jobs.


It is still ultimately a call centre job. So there is limited scope for a career if that is what you are looking for.


Not so much a con, but it is something to consider. There can be a large degree of responsibility for the job role you are paid for sometimes. This would be similiar to manning an emergency line in some cases, but even then nowhere near as pressured.


Certain jobs are monotonous and can become more of an excercise in tolerance.


The typical drugged up/drunk idiot callers and people looking to yell abuse at you down the line.
